name: Haazda Shield Mate
text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Haazda Shield Mate unless you pay {W}{W}.
{W}: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.

editions.flavor: The Haazda shield is broad, protecting both the free and the guilded.

name: Haazda Snare Squad
text: Whenever Haazda Snare Squad attacks, you may pay {W}. If you do, tap target creature an opponent controls.

editions.flavor: They've been probation officers, army grunts, bounty hunters—anything to make their district safer.

name: Hada Freeblade
text: Whenever Hada Freeblade or another Ally enters the battlefield under your control, you may put a +1/+1 counter on Hada Freeblade.

editions.flavor: "I toiled in Kazuul's mines when I was eight. I think I'm tough enough for a little hiking."

name: Hada Spy Patrol
text:
Level up {2}{U} ({2}{U}: Put a level counter on this. Level up only as a sorcery.)
LEVEL 1-2
2/2
Hada Spy Patrol can't be blocked.
LEVEL 3+
3/3
Shroud (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
Hada Spy Patrol can't be blocked.

name: Hag Hedge-Mage
text:
When Hag Hedge-Mage enters the battlefield, if you control two or more Swamps, you may have target player discard a card.
When Hag Hedge-Mage enters the battlefield, if you control two or more Forests, you may put target card from your graveyard on top of your library.

name: Hagra Crocodile
text:
Hagra Crocodile can't block.
Landfall — Whenever a land enters the battlefield under your control, Hagra Crocodile gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: The creatures of Zendikar are opportunists, eating whatever is available to them. Like goblins. Or boats.

name: Hagra Diabolist
text: Whenever Hagra Diabolist or another Ally enters the battlefield under your control, you may have target player lose life equal to the number of Allies you control.

editions.flavor: "When exploring the darkest regions, wickedness can be the best accomplice of all."

name: Hagra Sharpshooter
text: {4}{B}: Target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: "It's hard to find their weak points, but I very much enjoy the discovery process."

name: Hail of Arrows
text: Hail of Arrows deals X damage divided as you choose among any number of target attacking creatures.

editions.flavor:
"Do not let a single shaft loose until my word. And when I give that word, do not leave a single shaft in Eiganjo."
—General Takeno

"Do not let a single shaft loose until my word. And when I give that word, do not leave a single shaft in Eiganjo."
—General Takeno

"Do not let a single shaft loose until my word. And when I give that word, do not leave a single shaft in Eiganjo."
—General Takeno

name: Hail Storm
text: Hail Storm deals 2 damage to each attacking creature and 1 damage to you and each creature you control.

editions.flavor:
"If they can't take the hail, they'd better stay home."
—Arna Kennerüd, skycaptain

"If they can't take the hail, they'd better stay home."
—Arna Kennerüd, Skycaptain

name: Hair-Strung Koto
text: Tap an untapped creature you control: Target player puts the top card of his or her library into his or her graveyard.

editions.flavor:
"The Kami War drove many members of Konda's court insane. As their spiritual world turned against them, so too did their minds turn from reality."
—The History of Kamigawa

name: Hakim, Loreweaver
text:
Flying
{U}{U}: Return target Aura card from your graveyard to the battlefield attached to Hakim, Loreweaver. Activate this ability only during your upkeep and only if Hakim isn't enchanted.
{U}{U}, {T}: Destroy all Auras attached to Hakim.

name: Halam Djinn
text:
Haste
Halam Djinn gets -2/-2 as long as red is the most common color among all permanents or is tied for most common.

name: Halberdier
text: First strike

editions.flavor: His reputation precedes him—and so does his weapon.

name: Halcyon Glaze
text: Whenever you cast a creature spell, Halcyon Glaze becomes a 4/4 Illusion creature with flying in addition to its other types until end of turn.

editions.flavor:
"Earth to æther, window to wonder, stillness to the sky."
—Glazing incantation

name: Halfdane
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, change Halfdane's base power and toughness to the power and toughness of target creature other than Halfdane until the end of your next upkeep.

editions.flavor: Hail from Tolaria the ever changing 'Dane.
Hail from Tolaria the ever changing 'Dane.

text:
Halimar Depths enters the battlefield tapped.
When Halimar Depths enters the battlefield, look at the top three cards of your library, then put them back in any order.
{T}: Add {U} to your mana pool.

name: Halimar Excavator
text: Whenever Halimar Excavator or another Ally enters the battlefield under your control, target player puts the top X cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard, where X is the number of Allies you control.

name: Halimar Tidecaller
text:
When Halimar Tidecaller enters the battlefield, you may return target card with awaken from your graveyard to your hand.
Land creatures you control have flying.

editions.flavor: "Quiet the waves? Why would I want to do that?"

text:
Hall of the Bandit Lord enters the battlefield tapped.

text:

Creatures you control of the chosen color get +1/+1.

editions.flavor: Heroes act without thought of glory or reward. Accolades are a consequence, not a goal.
Heroes act without thought of glory or reward. Accolades are a consequence, not a goal.

name: Hallow
text: Prevent all damage target spell would deal this turn. You gain life equal to the damage prevented this way.

editions.flavor: "Bend with the storm, then reply in kind."

name: Hallowed Burial
text: Put all creatures on the bottom of their owners' libraries.

editions.flavor:
"I'd rather hear the screams of battle than the quiet that follows."
—Talara, elvish safewright

name: Hallowed Fountain
text:
({T}: Add {W} or {U} to your mana pool.)
As Hallowed Fountain enters the battlefield, you may pay 2 life. If you don't, Hallowed Fountain enters the battlefield tapped.

editions.flavor: A place to relax, if you have the proper permit.

name: Hallowed Ground
text: {W}{W}: Return target nonsnow land you control to its owner's hand.

editions.flavor:

Threshold — {T}: Prevent the next 4 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn. Activate this ability only if seven or more cards are in your graveyard.

name: Hallowed Moonlight
text:
Until end of turn, if a creature would enter the battlefield and it wasn't cast, exile it instead.
Draw a card.

text:
Vigilance
When Hallowed Spiritkeeper dies, create X 1/1 white Spirit creature tokens with flying, where X is the number of creature cards in your graveyard.

name: Halls of Mist
text:
Cumulative upkeep {1} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
Creatures that attacked during their controller's last turn can't attack.

name: Halo Hunter
text:
Intimidate (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or creatures that share a color with it.)
When Halo Hunter enters the battlefield, destroy target Angel.

editions.flavor: Hanging on the walls of his lair, the fallen halos cast his depravity in everlasting light.

name: Halt Order
text:
Counter target artifact spell.
Draw a card.

editions.flavor: An artificer's least favorite mind-missive may be "I regret to inform you that the funding for your project has been cut."

name: Hamletback Goliath
text: Whenever another creature enters the battlefield, you may put X +1/+1 counters on Hamletback Goliath, where X is that creature's power.

editions.flavor:

text: Whenever Hamlet Captain attacks or blocks, other Humans you control get +1/+1 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: "Bloodsuckers, howlers, monsters from the beyond . . . it doesn't much matter. I won't have to face them alone."
"I would fear this fight, bloodsucker, were I alone."

name: Hammerfist Giant
text: {T}: Hammerfist Giant deals 4 damage to each creature without flying and each player.

text: Hammerhead Shark can't attack unless defending player controls an Island.

text:

text: {X}{R}, {T}, Discard a card: Destroy all artifacts with converted mana cost X or less.

editions.flavor: It grew in lands lit by pride and watered by tears.

"That was fun! Now me."

Protection from white

editions.flavor: "The sword is just a tool. It is the samurai's hand that delivers death."

text: Destroy target nonblack creature.

text:

Bushido 1 (Whenever this creature blocks or becomes blocked, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)

name: Hand of Silumgar
text: Deathtouch (Any amount of damage this deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)

Infect (This creature deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)

name: Hand to Hand
text: During combat, players can't cast instant spells or activate abilities that aren't mana abilities.

editions.flavor: The match between Tahngarth and Greven was close only in the mind of the minotaur.

name: Hanna
text: Spells you cast cost {1} less to cast.

editions.flavor: Educated in Argive and highly knowledgeable in the field of artifacts, this expert navigator of the Weatherlight believes that scholarship does not necessarily lead to understanding. Her diligence in pursuing both is her greatest asset.

text: All artifacts have shroud. (They can't be the targets of spells or abilities.)

editions.flavor: Scholars possess such lofty knowledge that it shouldn't be surprising when they fall.

Flying

text:

name: Harsh Deceiver
text:
{1}: Look at the top card of your library.
{2}: Reveal the top card of your library. If it's a land card, untap Harsh Deceiver and it gets +1/+1 until end of turn. Activate this ability only once each turn.

name: Harsh Judgment
text:

If an instant or sorcery spell of the chosen color would deal damage to you, it deals that damage to its controller instead.

editions.flavor:
"At least they remember me."
—Gerrard

name: Harsh Justice
text:
Cast Harsh Justice only during the declare attackers step and only if you've been attacked this step.
This turn, whenever an attacking creature deals combat damage to you, it deals that much damage to its controller.

name: Harsh Mercy
text: Each player chooses a creature type. Destroy all creatures that aren't of a type chosen this way. They can't be regenerated.

editions.flavor:
"There is no greater burden than choosing who to save."
—Kamahl, druid acolyte

name: Harsh Scrutiny

editions.flavor:
"If you've done nothing wrong, you have nothing to fear."
—Enforcer-Chief Ranaj

name: Harsh Sustenance

editions.flavor: The Shifting Wastes provide refuge to those who know where to look for it.

name: Haru-Onna
text:
